page.title: 09Health Service Cookley Green
page.content: There are two group practices serving this area, one at Watlington and one at Nettlebed. There is no official catchment area for these practices, but doctors try to arrange matters to avoid unnecessary travelling for themselves or patients. Surgeries are open some time everyday except Saturday and Sunday for patients to attend by appointment. Doctors make home visits when people are too ill or infirm to go to the surgery. District nurses, midwives and health visitors make home visits when needed. The nurses are based with the group practice and work with the doctors. Doctors can be contacted by telephone throughout the day and night for emergency calls. Doctors organise clinics for ante-natal and post-natal care and for mothers with babies and toddlers.
